alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 3:18AM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cheyenne County in east central Colorado through 400 AM MDT... At 316 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 13 miles north of Haswell, or 42 miles west of Cheyenne Wells, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph, half inch hail and torrential rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Torrential rainfall with this storm may lead to localized flooding, especially in low-lying areas. This storm will remain over rural areas of southwestern Cheyenne County in Colorado, including the following locations... Wild Horse and Aroya. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM MDT.
